author: Joanna Cismaru
title: Korean Fried Chicken
ingredients: 2 pounds chicken breasts (boneless and skinless, cut into 1 inch pieces)
2 pounds chicken breasts (boneless and skinless, cut into 1 inch pieces)

instructions_list: Toss the chicken pieces through the egg first, then dredge through cornstarch.
Add about 3 inches of oil to a heavy bottom pan and heat to 375Â°F.
Add chicken to the pan and fry in batches about 3 to 4 minutes per batch. Transfer the chicken to a paper towel lined plate and repeat with remaining chicken.

Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 30 seconds or until aromatic. Stir in the brown sugar and honey and cook for about 1 minute until the brown butter dissolves. Add the soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil and gochujang sauce to the skillet and stir. Cook for 30 seconds then add the chicken to the skillet and toss well with the sauce.
Serve garnished with green onions, toasted sesame seeds and red chilis.
description: Korean Fried Chicken - juicy, yet crispy pieces of chicken coated in a sweet and spicy sauce. An easy fried chicken recipe with a fiery kick making for the perfect meal or appetizer. This chicken truly is perfect for any occasion.

reviews.author: Olivia
reviews.reviewBody: This recipe is my absolute favorite!! My husband said this is better than the chicken at his favorite Asian restaurant. I thought this dish was going to be complex but it was surprisingly easy. My chicken also looked just like the picture which never happens. I highly recommend making this dish. It is now my go to dish to impress my family and guest.

reviews.author: Chris
reviews.reviewBody:
This recipe is absolutely brilliant!, it's  restaurant quality I have to say. I do have one question, I saw on the photos of the ingredients and there is a photo of salt and pepper but I didn't see that on the instructions and the ingredients list although I didn't add it but maybe next time would you recommend to add it to the cornstarch while breading chicken or not really needed? 
Other than that Thanks for your recipe perfect recipe for a Saturday night in

reviews.author: Martin Hughes
reviews.reviewBody: I made this after eating Korean chicken in a restaurant. This recipe is excellent. Really  authentic. Was even better than I had in the Korean restaurant. Iâ€™ve shared  it with loads of my friends and they  have come back and said the same.

reviews.author: CarolZ
reviews.reviewBody: This really was absolutely delicious. The sauce was perfect - a little heat and not too sweet. The chicken was crispy because of the corn starch. I made broccoli and rice with it.  What a great meal.
